ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I recommend this course for anyone interested in the work of John Rawls in particular and political philosophy in general.

it is a rigorous and in depth analysis of Rawls, and Rawls alone. Every student in philosophy and political science should probably take this course. The course allows you to come into dialogue with Rawls, which will be a tool that will remain useful for the rest of your career.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course gave me a firm grasp on the work of the most widely discussed thinker in my sub-field of interest. Very helpful.

This course was extremely important to me, it will allows me to engage Rawls in my future work in political theory. I don't think I will ever be doing pure analytical political philosophy, but it is still incredibly important to be able to be in dialogue with and engage with this material. It's Rawls, afterall.
